results.title: Offspring of isolation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
A survey of Australia’s unique animals, which evolved as a result of Australia’s isolation from other land masses. Platypuses, wombats, kangaroos, echidnas and marsupials are seen in their natural state. Delightful shots of our most appealing fauna. Narrated by Peter Wagner.

results.title: The Fox and the hound
results.creator_credit: Richard Rich, Ted Berman, Wolfgang Reitherman, Art Stevens and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This classic Disney tale is a heartwarming story of two best friends who didn’t know they were supposed to be enemies. Orphaned fox cub Tod is adopted by a lonely widow, and the fun and adventure begins when he meets Copper, an adorable hound puppy. Under the watchful eyes of Big Mama Owl, the innocent pair play and frolic in the forest, becoming inseparable friends - each unaware that the future will see them pitted against each other as each must fulfill his role in the scheme of things. Reflecting such timeless values as love, courage and the importance of friendship, and featuring the vocal talents of Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Sandy Duncan, Pearl Bailey and Corey Feldman, this is a very endearing movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: Children of Peru
results.creator_credit: Michael Andrews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others.

results.title: Breaking in children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Behaviour therapy although popular in the US as a method of treating difficult children is usually regarded by British authorities as fit only for animal training. This program looks at a therapist in Belfast working with two uncontrollable children and their mothers in an obey-reward, non compliance-punishment regime.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long. In Italian language.

results.title: The Forsyte saga (2002) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Menaul, Sita Williams and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Originally produced in 1967 by the BBC, John Galsworthy’s popular novel of life in early 20th century London as seen through the eyes of the Forsyte family is given a fresh injection of talent and production values in this 2002 Granada Television mini-series. Set in Victorian England, sex, corruption, greed and jealousy characterise the machinations and minutiae of two branches of the same family, headed by the patriarchs Jolyon (Corin Redgrave) and James (John Carlisle) Forsyte. Cast includes: Damian Lewis, Rupert Graves, Gina McKee, Corin Redgrave, Ioan Gruffudd. Written by Stephen Mallatratt.

results.title: The Forests and Vladimir Krajina
results.creator_credit: Peter Katadotis, Tom Radford, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visually seductive, this film uncovers a few hard truths under the packaging. Dr. Vladimir Krajina, botanist and teacher, is waging a successful battle in British Columbia for the creation of ecological reserves. He explains the importance of such sanctuaries and why people must know and respect nature’s laws if the future needs of the industry and the desire for a high quality of life are to be reconciled. Written by Barry Cowling and narrated by Stanley Jackson.
